This is a divine AA specifically designed for 30-level capped environments. It has been configured to meet the constraints of the Arelith server (as best I can grasp of the rules I've read about it, anyway) so could be conceivably modified slightly to spread out the bard dump levels more efficiently. I suppose it may work in PvP with the high damage and high attack level but it is really only designed with PvM in mind. At this writing, trainer-tested only.

General Comments

The listed build has been OPTIMIZED for the archer aspect of combat (See "Variants" section for optional approaches).
15 BAB has been maintained since this is intended to be played as a Divine Power archer.
The skill set emphasizes character alertness with Listen & Spot maxed, but with moderate UMD rating.

PROS
  • Good archer in early levels[/*:m]
  • AA +6 enhancement[/*:m]
  • Exalted AB while using Rapid Shot mode[/*:m]
  • Excellent buffed Called Shot attack (AB +53)[/*:m]
  • High damage attack 22-29 and 66-87 w/crit, with magical (divine) components[/*:m]
  • High saves, Fort 35/Will 38/Refl 39 vs. spells[/*:m]
  • Can use most monk and caster robes and equipment[/*:m]
[/list]

CONS

  • Poor carrying capacity without Bull's Strength active[/*:m]
  • Buffs easily dispelled[/*:m]
[/list]

Feat
Sacrifice 1AB and 1 DEX AC to get Weapon Finesse for melee encounters with a rapier and shield at significantly-reduced attack level but with access to Darkfire, GMW & +5 vestment AC on shield.

Class/ability Split
To gain the use of Level 9 cleric spells, sub in 2 levels of cleric for AA in epic, change DEX bump @24 to WIS and change feat from Great Dex I to Epic Prowess (or whatever you like). A Clc 17/Brd 4/AA 9 version will increase SR by 2 (per spell). Simultaneously, the AA enhancement will be reduced by 1 (from 6 to 5), -1 AB, -1 damage and -1 DEX AC. AA special attack DCs will also suffer.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Here's some ideas you might have already thought of and rejected.
* Boost WIS instead of DEX and use Zen Archery. At character creation, lowering DEX from 18 to 14 will give you the 6 points you need to raise WIS from 16 to 18. All this will give you +1 AB and more spells per day at the cost of Empower Spell.
* Replace Bard with Wizard. This would eliminate the EXP penalty because Wizard is the Elf's favored class. If you take this option, make the last level Cleric 16 to make you an ever-so-slightly stronger Cleric. Also, your 14 INT would enable you to cast some Wizard spells. Furthermore, replacing 2 AA levels with 2 more Wizard levels would give you a Wizard bonus feat, which would give you back Empower Spell if you went for my first suggestion.
* If you have the option to play as a female Drow, that would also eliminate the EXP penalty because her favored class would be Cleric.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:Here's some ideas you might have already thought of and rejected.
They are all good points, Empyre. Well worth discussing.
* Boost WIS instead of DEX and use Zen Archery. At character creation, lowering DEX from 18 to 14 will give you the 6 points you need to raise WIS from 16 to 18. All this will give you +1 AB and more spells per day at the cost of Empower Spell.
2 problems with that: First, my self-buffers live off of empowered ability levels. Getting +3 to +4 modifiers (depending on whether pre-buff level is even or odd number) makes just about all the aspects of the game easier to manage and easier to reach ability caps with mundane equipment. Secondly, the AA special attacks DC is based on DEX, not WIS. Those 3 fireballs per day are way more reliable vs. reflex with high DEX.
* Replace Bard with Wizard. This would eliminate the EXP penalty because Wizard is the Elf's favored class. If you take this option, make the last level Cleric 16 to make you an ever-so-slightly stronger Cleric. Also, your 14 INT would enable you to cast some Wizard spells. Furthermore, replacing 2 AA levels with 2 more Wizard levels would give you a Wizard bonus feat, which would give you back Empower Spell if you went for my first suggestion.
Except that this was designed for using on Arelith, my preference would have been Clc 17/Brd 2/AA 11 (or Clc 15/Brd 2/AA 13 for +7 enhancement). The mini song from Bard 3 is okay but not really needed because the AB cap can be reached without it. But all these servers have different customizations so it is near impossible to design a one-size-fits-all-PWs build. It is what it is.

Yes. I've used Wizard when UMD was not desirable and when most skills didn't matter (usually the case on high-magic servers). As one of the build's advantages, I just love those monk robes & boots for my archer. In some occasions, there are sweet ranger bows that can be used. If the server doesn't offer good class-specific equipment, the value of UMD drops dramatically IMO. But TBH, there are no low-level Wiz spells that either cleric already has (like Find Traps, for example) or that are useful. The only ones that would be significant are mantles and breaches but I wouldn't want to commit to more than 5 or 6 wiz levels... just dilutes the build's strengths too much even with that many levels. Each 2 less AA levels drops DR piercing level by 1 and cleric is set at least at 15 and preferably higher to access to all spells.

Also, with bard I wanted to assure an alertness that utilized max Spot/Listen against those pesky sneakers. Wizard just doesn't provide that option. I have already played something similar to this on a server with a re-leveler where I could get it to level cap with wiz and then re-level in bard to take advantage of the better skill set. Another option I have used is to just ignore Rapid Shot altogether (again, my focus on Called Shot as the staple of the build comes into play here), use half-elf and martial prof instead. TBH, during the heat of battle I forget to queue RS many times so fight with -1APR (but +2AB!). Not an excuse, just a fact for me. When RS is worth the most... in early pre-epic... it sucks down the AB too much (2AB is a lot until BAB of about 6 is reached IMO) to be as effective as just relying on Haste & DP, neither of which costs any AB to boost APR.

Long explanation why I feel bard is superior, sry.
* If you have the option to play as a female Drow, that would also eliminate the EXP penalty because her favored class would be Cleric.
That's something I have never experienced... a class that favors cleric. Hmmmm... Sounds like fun. I suppose that is a PRC class?
